holidays.name: Friendship Day (Selected Countries)
holidays.description: A day to celebrate friendships and honor those special people in our lives.
holidays.origin: 1970s movement promoted by the greeting card industry and recognized officially in some countries on July 20.
holidays.funFact: Some countries celebrate Friendship Day on other dates; the quirky July 20 version has grown popular in places like India.

holidays.name: National Lollipop Day

holidays.origin: Created by candy enthusiasts who wanted to honor this classic confection.
holidays.funFact: The word 'lollipop' first appeared in English dictionaries as early as 1931, but similar sweets date back centuries!

holidays.name: International Chess Day
holidays.description: Commemorates the founding of the International Chess Federation (FIDE) on July 20, 1924, and celebrates the game of chess worldwide.
holidays.origin: Established by FIDE in 1966 to promote chess as a universal language.
holidays.funFact: The longest chess game theoretically possible is 5,949 moves!
